turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hey, where's Finch?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Went home to shit.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I don't get it.  How does a guy like that get this sudden reputation?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You can send me the address too.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well...dammit, if I'm doing this, how the hell am I gonna watch?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I'll save you a seat.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Did I miss anything?!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Just in time.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: But, but -- what would I do?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Anything!  Just tell her it looks like she needs an extra hand or something.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: That's stupid.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: No, you're stupid.  Get going!  Right now!  She's primed!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh...oh...oh, shit!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh boy oh God oh crap oh no.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Come on, Jim.  Where are you?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Please, God.  Let this be it.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: He's going in!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Holy shit!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Hey, minuteman.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Shut up.  You're supposed to be supportive.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: How do you know that?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: She's already on a plane back home.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yeah?  Well come prom night, those excuses aren't going to do you much good.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Jesus, Kevin, rub it in.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeeeeeeeaaaawwwwww!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You fuckin' rule!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Alright, how do you guys stand?  Well, Finch, I know where you are, but you can't use that as an excuse.  Jim?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: My date's a flute-toting band dork. That answer your question?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Oz, how about you and Heather?  Now you guys are a couple or something?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Back out?  You don't need <u>us</u> to get laid.  You afraid or something?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: No, but come on guys, we made a pact!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Kevin, come on, the bus to Stifler's is gonna be here soon.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I'm not going.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No, no that's fine.  So you doing okay?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: What the heck is this?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Nothing!

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: Can I come in?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: You're not...busy?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Dad, come in.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: These are for you.  From father to son.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I know, Dad.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: Oh, okay.  Here's let me show you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Dad!  I know!

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: Do you know about the clitoris?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yes dad.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: Sometimes it can be pretty hard to locate.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Thank you, dad, I got it.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: Okay, well that about covers it.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: Jim?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It's not what it looks like!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Dad, please stop.  Please.  I'm sure I know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: Sure you know, son, but I think you've been having a little problem with it. It's okay, though.  What you're doing is perfectly normal.  It's like practice.  Like when you play tennis against a wall.  Some day, there'll be a partner returning the ball.  You do want a partner, don't you son?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: That's great.  Now remember, it's <u>okay</u> to play with yourself.  Or, as I always called it --  "Stroke the salami!"  Ho-ho, Jim.  There's nothing to be ashamed of.  Hell, I'm fifty-two, and I still enjoy masturbating.  Uncle Mort masturbates.  We <u>all</u> masturbate.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: Son.  This lady's here for you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I know.  Hey Nadia.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Dad.

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: Oh, no, not too much of a bookworm. He's a good little kid.  Er, guy. Man.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Dad!!

turns.speaker: JIM'S DAD
turns.text: Okay, okay.  I'll let you hit those books.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hold on.  You have no idea why I'm angry?

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Is it because we have a test tomorrow? Sometimes I get cranky when I know I have a big test to study for.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah, that's pretty much it.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: I thought so.  Because, one time?  I was at this --

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What was your name again?

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Michelle.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Okay.  Michelle, do you want to be my date for the prom?

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Really?  You seriously want to go with me?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yes.  Seriously.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Are we going to Steve Stifler's party afterwards?  That would be so cool.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Whatever you want.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Cool!  We're gonna have so much fun! It's like this one time, at band camp...

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: You know, at band camp?  We have dances like this.  Only they're way funner.  Don't you think prom is just highly overrated?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Highly, highly overrated.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Stifler's mom got it in the divorce.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: It reminds me of this one time --  Hey, can I ask you a question?  How come you don't have any stories?  I've got lots of stories, and you don't have any.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh, I've got stories, believe me. They're a little more risque than tales of Band Camp.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Are they gross or something, like guy stuff?  Tell me.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Okay.  You want a story?  Here's a story.  Stifler finds this beer, right?  And...

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: That is a <u>nasty</u> story!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I told you.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: You wanna hear a nasty story of mine? It's kind of sexual.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah, bring it on!

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Well, this one time?  At band camp? We were playing this game, I don't know if you know it?  But it's called spin the bottle?  And I had to kiss this guy named Marc Wander on the lips?  And...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: So, the end of the story is...you had to kiss the guy for twenty seconds?

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Yes!  And he was such a dork!  And everyone laughed at me, but I didn't care?  Because it was so funny!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Okay, I get it.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Oh!  And then this one time?  At band camp?  I stuck a flute in my pussy.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: ...excuse me?!

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: What, you think I don't know how to get myself off?  Hell, that's what half of band camp is!  Sex ed!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: This'll do.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Now, I have two rubbers.  Wear them both, it'll desensitize you.  I don't want you coming so damn early.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Why, uh, what makes you think that I --

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Come on.  I saw you on the net.  Why do you think I accepted this date? You're a sure thing!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Are you gonna do what I think you're gonna do?

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Don't you want me to?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh yeah!  Put it in your mouth!

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Okay!

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Illegal channels?  Shit, if there's any channel that should be illegal, it's whatever that women's channel is. Lifetime Supply of Pantyhose, or some shit.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah -- hey, did you see The Little Mermaid on TV the other night?  That Ariel, whew.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: She's a mermaid, dude.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah, Oz, but not when she's on land.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: She's a <u>cartoon</u>, dude.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: A <u>hot</u> cartoon.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Is there anything you don't jerk off to?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: C-Span?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: You guys got the Latin homework?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No -- Kevin, you?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Ooh, here's an easy one:  "Attractive SWF, fun loving and a youthful mind seeks outgoing companion." Okay..."Attractive"...ugly.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: "Fun loving" -- insane.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: This was remade?  Into what?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Bli-hinded by the light -- cut loose like a deuce, another runner in the night, blinded...

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Who cares?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Nadia does, that Czechoslovakian chick, she might be there tonight. Now, do you think she'd prefer --  Cool Hip Jim...  or Laid Back Jim?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Shortstop.  'Course, you don't make it to third, and you're out.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: So let's say you get there...what's uh, third base feel like?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Feels like warm apple pie, dude.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Apple pie...  McDonald's or homemade?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hey, you did better than I did, Nova.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Oh that's really reassuring.  And don't call me Nova anymore.  I'm a fraud.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Hey guys, you came to watch me in action?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah, I think you sounded pretty good.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: You can do that?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh -- no way.  I can't do that to her.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: You've still got a chance with Nadia, right?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No.  Her sponsors here saw the thing on the net.  I don't think they liked it.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I still think you're okay.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: So do I, Kev.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: There it is.  I want to grab my bag. Oh, and my date.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: Come on, Kevin.  Vicky's looking for you.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I'll just say that we had a great night together.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hang in there, buddy, you'll get there.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: It's true.  I mean, after this, everything'll be different.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: After getting laid?

turns.speaker: OZ
turns.text: After high school.

turns.speaker: SHERMAN
turns.text: What's up, fellas?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hey Sherman.  Scopin' the babes.

turns.speaker: SHERMAN
turns.text: Indeed.  Some fine ladies here, boys. Confidence is high, repeat, confidence is high. Sherman is moving to DefCon Two, full strategic arsenal ready for deployment.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You've got something going?

turns.speaker: SHERMAN
turns.text: Did you see that Central chick? Brunette?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You did it.

turns.speaker: SHERMAN
turns.text: Fellas, say goodbye to Chuck Sherman, the boy.  I am now a man.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I thought so.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No...you...go...ahead.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You are very good in the world history class, yes?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yes.  No.  Yes.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Perhaps you can help me with my studies?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Okay...that would be cool sometime.  How 'bout tomorrow?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Well, I do have ballet practice. Perhaps I can come by your house afterwards.  I can change clothes at your place?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I suppose that would be okay.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: So you need to change, right?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Do you mind?  This fabric is so uncomfortable.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: James!  You have come in here on purpose?!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well...uh...

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Shame on you!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Uh...yeah...sorry.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Well.  You have seen me.  Now it is my turn to see you.  Strip.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Strip?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes, slowly.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You mean like, <u>strip</u> strip?

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: For me?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Uh...

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Move with the music.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Um...okay...

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: No, no, you must put your whole body into it.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Nadia, I can't --

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Can't what?  Do you not want to be with me?  I wish to be entertained, James.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Jim...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh no.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: You are done, James.  Perhaps I should be going now.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No, no, I'm not done!  I've got reserves!  Nadia, please please please.  I'm begging you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Did you see this?  This is your more exotic dirty magazine.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: Yes...James, it is knowing that these beautiful women arouse you that arouses me...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh yes.  Very arousing women.  They arouse me very much.  But not as arousing as you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No, not again.

turns.speaker: NADIA
turns.text: I am sorry, Jim.  I suppose we will not be doing any studying now.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No!  I've got...reserve reserves!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Stifler, you're such an asshole.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Meyers, what's the deal with you and Vicky, anyway?  You've been going out since Homecoming and all she'll do is blow you?  Shit, I'd drop her like a steaming turd.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: SUCK ME, BEAUTIFUL!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: God dammit, Stifler!

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Check-out time!  Please vacate the room.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Ho-lee shit.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: This just got a hell of a lot better.

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Kevin!  You seen Shitbreak lately?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Oh no, Stifler, what did you do?

turns.speaker: STIFLER
turns.text: Me?  Nothing.  I'm the one whose ass he kicked.  I'll tell you one thing, though.  I don't think he's gonna have a problem shitting in school anymore.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: It's a big, thick envelope, Vicky. You got in.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: You think so?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: "Dear Ms. Hughes.  We're sorry, but after keeping you on the wait list for the past couple months, we've decided you are now rejected.  Enclosed is a 100-page, full-color brochure on how rejected you are."

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Kevin, this is serious!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You got in.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Oh, Kev.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Vicky -- do you think, maybe...it's time for us to take the next step in our relationship?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Tonight?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yeah, it's such a perfect evening. Isn't this how you've always pictured it?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Let me know.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Okay, don't stop.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Vicky, wait.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Not for you.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I was being selfish.  And majorly insensitive.  And I'm a total idiot.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: I think "shithead" really says it.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yes!  I'm a shithead!  I'm a complete and total shithead!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: And I want to try to make it up to you.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Oh...ungghhhhh!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Shhhh.  Your parents are downstairs.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Oh Kevin -- don't stop!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Just a second!

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You're not doing the extra credit problems.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: No, I'm not.  I'm writing a sequence of random numbers that look like I'm doing the extra credit problems.  Mr. Bender doesn't bother to check homework past April.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: That's my trick!

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: It's everyone's trick, Kevin.  But I did pick it up from you.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: We've come a long way since Homecoming.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Yeah, we have.  You corrupted my four- point into a three-nine-five.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Indeed I did.  But, our relationship. It's progressed a lot.  It's time for us to...express ourselves in new ways.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Like how?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Well, I feel that...things are getting to that point in a relationship. When two people share...a special moment between them.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: I think you're so right, Kevin.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You want to do it?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Yes --

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Kevin?  Do you not love me?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: No, I don't not love you.  I like, I know that we've definitely got <u>something</u> between us.  Something good. Something special.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: But you don't love me.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I didn't say that.  I mean, love, it's like a term that gets thrown around. People say things, they get married, have kids, and then what?  It's like they call it off, going "I was wrong."

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Kevin...you're not your dad.  The two of us, we're not your parents.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I know, Vick.  I'm just not ready yet, okay?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Hey...

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Did you know that it's...450 miles from Ann Arbor to Nashville?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: It's like a six or seven hour drive. That's easy, I don't mind driving.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: About the other day...I've been thinking.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: So have I.  And I know you want to make things perfect for me.  And I understand that you really wouldn't tell me that until you were 100% comfortable with it.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: And I want to make things perfect for you.  You're right, Kev, we do have something good...and special.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yeah, we have something great, Vick.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Kevin...  I want to have sex with you.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Now?!

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: No...I know the perfect time...

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: See -- this is the nicest room.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Wow, Kev...it's perfect.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: You comfortable?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Yeah, are you?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: You sure you're comfortable?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yeah.  Are you sure?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Okay.  Did you bring a condom?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yeah, right here.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: So, do you want to be -- I mean, how do you want to do it?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: I don't know.  How do you?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Like, normal style.  The...missionary position.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yeah Vick?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: I want to hear you say it.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Victoria...I love you.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: That was a great night.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I can't believe we just had our senior prom.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Yeah, the time went by so fast.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: It did.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Kevin, next year...with you in Ann Arbor, and me in Nashville...it's not gonna work, is it.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Don't say that, we can do it somehow. It might not be perfect, but --

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: No, Kevin --  That's the whole thing, that's what I've been realizing.  That nothing's perfect, that you can't plan everything.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Vicky...last night...I wasn't lying.

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: I know.  Let's go.  Don't you have something to tell your friends?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: VICKY
turns.text: Your little pact.  Jessica told me all about it.  Way to go, Kev!

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: You called me to ask me how to get laid?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: What was I gonna do, call dad?  I don't even know his number.

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: Just dial 976-Asshole.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Yeah, well anyway...I thought you might have some advice, brother to brother.  I mean, I think tonight she might, we might really, there's a chance that -- you know.

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: Have you ever heard of the bible?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: What?  Not <u>the</u> Bible?

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: Well, that's not really the name, but we always called it that.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Does it tell me how to get laid?

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: You know what, nevermind.  You're not ready.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Ready for what?

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: Whoop, you're fading out.  Good luck at that party.

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: Say that again, Kevin?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Uh...I thought you might know a trick or something.  To make her, you know...

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: Try the spicy tuna hand roll.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: What?!  How do I do that?

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: Uh -- forget that.  Look, is that all you're interested in?  Ways to get your girlfriend into bed?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Well, no.  I think...I guess it would be good to be able to return the favor.  I mean, it would be nice to know she enjoys things as much as I do.

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: That's good, that's what I needed to hear.  Now you qualify.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Qualify for what?

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: You've just inherited The Bible.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Hey.  I got another question for you.

turns.speaker: KEVIN'S BROTHER
turns.text: What's that?
